court: HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT
outcome: This is a petition filed under Section 482 of Cr.P.C. seeking to have all further proceedings in Crime No. 3128 of 2013 of Chalakkudy Police Station quashed
full_text: ue Pate 2014/KER/210 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR.JUSTICE PBHAVADASAN THURSDAY, THE 2ND DAY OF JANUARY 2014/12TH POUSHA, 1935 Cri.MC.No. 23 of 2014 CRIME NO. 3128/2013 OF CHALAKKUDY POLICE STATION , THRISSUR DISTRICT. PETITIONER/ACCUSED: 1. PONNATHA, AGED 27 YEARS, W/O.SENTHIL, DOOR NO.22, VADIPETTI DESHAM, MADURAI, TAMIL NADU. 2. AACHI, AGED 26 YEARS, D/O.AYYAPPAN, DOOR NO.22, VADIPETTI DESHAM, MADURAI, TAMIL NADU. BY ADV. SRI.K.S.ARUN KUMAR RESPONDENTS/COMPLAINANT: 1. STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM. 2. NISHA, AGED 33 YEARS, W/O.SANDEEP, CHEKKUTTU VEEDU, PAZHAMBILLI DESOM, KODAKARA VILLAGE, THRISSUR DISTRICT. R1 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SMT. DHANESH MATHEW R2 BY ADV. SMT.RESMI] THOMAS THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 02-01-2014, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Msd. ae Pate 2014/KER/210 Cri.MC.No. 23 of 2014 APPENDIX PETITIONER(S) ANNEXURE: ANNEXURE-!I: TRUE COPY OF THE FIR IN CRIME NO.3128/2013 OF CHALAKKUDY POLICE STATION, THRISSUR. ANNEXURE-II: TRUE COPY OF THE AFFIDAVIT SWORN BY THE SECOND RESPONDENT. RESPONDENT(S) ANNEXURE: NIL TRUE COPY\\ P.A.TO JUDGE. Msd. uml 2014/KER/210 P.BHAVADASAN, J. ~ CrLM.C. No. 23 of 2014 Dated this the 02 day of January, 2014 ORDER This is a petition filed under Section 482 of Cr.P.C. seeking to have all further proceedings in Crime No. 3128 of 2013 of Chalakkudy Police Station quashed. 2. The petitioner stands accused of having committed the offence punishable under Section 379 read with Section 34 of IPC. 3. It is unnecessary to go into the facts and details of the case for the simple reason that the petitioners have impleaded the defacto complaint/victim as the second respondent who has entered appearance through a counsel and the learned counsel appearing for the second respondent has accepted that the Annexure-ll affidavit filed along with this petition is one sworn to by the defacto complainant herself and she stands by the statements contained therein. an a 2014/KER/210 Crl.M.C. No.23/2014 -2- On going through Annexure-ll affidavit, it is seen that the parties have settled all their differences and issues between them and no further grievance remains to be resolved between the victim and the accused. It is pointed out that the victim is disinterested in continuing the matter. In the light of the statement made in the affidavit, it is felt that continuance of the proceedings will only be an exercise in futility. In the result, this petition is allowed. All further proceedings in Crime No. 3128 of 2013 of Chalakkudy Police Station including the FIR shall stand quashed and the petitioner shall stand discharged and all further proceedings shall stand dropped. P.BHAVADASAN JUDGE ds
